intro: Antirhea viscosa, commonly known as the sticky antirhea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Its sticky resin, which gives it its common name, has been used traditionally in local medicine. The plant's ornamental value and unique properties make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ethnobotanical research.
